page.title: 01Mentmore and its Environs
page.content: Our area's main village{Mentmore}is dominated by the stately home, {Mentmore Towers,}but it also includes the tiny hamlet of{Crafton}and part of {Ledburn}village. The countryside is undulating and lies within the northern reaches of the{Aylesbury {Vale.}There are several farms in the area and the land is largely arable, with a little pasture but a lot of the inhabitants are commuters, using the main line to Euston from nearby Leighton Buzzard or Cheddington stations. To a casual onlooker from one of the few roads which cross it, the land would probably seem flat and boring but this is far from the case. There is considerable natural wildlife, and the human residents make use of their surroundings in ways that are often unusual and interesting, as well as the more traditional.
